## Go API: Create and Run reviewdog Instance

```go
package main

import (
    "context"
    "log"
    "os"
    "os/exec"

    "github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog"
    "github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog/filter"
    "github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog/parser"
)

func main() {
    ctx := context.Background()

    // Create parser for golint output
    p, _ := parser.New(&parser.Option{
        FormatName: "golint",
    })

    // Create comment service (stdout writer)
    cs := reviewdog.NewRawCommentWriter(os.Stdout)

    // Create diff service
    ds, _ := reviewdog.NewDiffCmd(
        exec.Command("git", "diff", "--relative", "master"),
        1, // strip level
    )

    // Create reviewdog instance
    rd := reviewdog.NewReviewdog(
        "golint",                  // tool name
        p,                         // parser
        cs,                        // comment service
        ds,                        // diff service
        filter.ModeAdded,          // filter mode
        reviewdog.FailLevelNone,   // fail level
    )

    // Run reviewdog with linter output from stdin
    if err := rd.Run(ctx, os.Stdin); err != nil {
        log.Fatal(err)
    }
}
```

## Parse linter output with predefined format (Go)

```bash
# Run golint and pipe to reviewdog with local reporter
golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"

# Output example:
# comment_iowriter.go:11:6: [golint] exported type CommentWriter should have comment or be unexported

# List all available predefined formats
reviewdog -list

# Output includes formats like:
# golint          linter for Go source code                                       - https://github.com/golang/lint
# govet           Vet examines Go source code and reports suspicious problems     - https://golang.org/cmd/vet/
# eslint          The pluggable linting utility for JavaScript and JSX            - https://eslint.org/
```

## Using reviewdog with Guess Mode (Shell)

```shell
$ reviewdog -conf=.reviewdog.yml -reporter=github-pr-check -guess
```

## Using Pre-defined Errorformats with reviewdog

```shell
$ reviewdog -list
golint          linter for Go source code                                       - https://github.com/golang/lint
govet           Vet examines Go source code and reports suspicious problems     - https://golang.org/cmd/vet/
sbt             the interactive build tool                                      - http://www.scala-sbt.org/
...
$ golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"
```

## Using Checkstyle XML Format with reviewdog

```shell
# Local
$ eslint -f checkstyle . | reviewdog -f=checkstyle -diff="git diff"
```

## Using SARIF format with reviewdog (Shell)

```shell
eslint -f @microsoft/eslint-formatter-sarif . | reviewdog -f=sarif -diff="git diff"
```

## Running reviewdog with a Configuration File (Shell)

```shell
reviewdog -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"
project/run_test.go:61:28: [golint] error strings should not end with punctuation
project/run.go:57:18: [errcheck]        defer os.Setenv(name, os.Getenv(name))
project/run.go:58:12: [errcheck]        os.Setenv(name, "")
# You can use -runners to run only specified runners.
reviewdog -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD" -runners=golint,govet
project/run_test.go:61:28: [golint] error strings should not end with punctuation
# You can use -conf to specify config file path.
reviewdog -conf=./.reviewdog.yml -reporter=github-pr-check
```

## Use nofilter mode with github-pr-review reporter and fail-on-error

```shell
reviewdog -reporter=github-pr-review -filter-mode=nofilter -fail-on-error
```

## Implement Parser Interface for Custom Format in Go

```go
package main

import (
    "bufio"
    "io"
    "regexp"
    "strconv"

    "github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog/proto/rdf"
)

// CustomParser implements parser.Parser interface
type CustomParser struct {
    pattern *regexp.Regexp
}

// Parse implements parser.Parser.Parse
func (p *CustomParser) Parse(r io.Reader) ([]*rdf.Diagnostic, error) {
    scanner := bufio.NewScanner(r)
    var diagnostics []*rdf.Diagnostic

    // Example format: "file.go:10:5:warning: message text"
    p.pattern = regexp.MustCompile(`^(.+):(\d+):(\d+):(\w+):\s*(.+)$`)

    for scanner.Scan() {
        line := scanner.Text()
        matches := p.pattern.FindStringSubmatch(line)
        if matches == nil {
            continue
        }

        lineNum, _ := strconv.Atoi(matches[2])
        colNum, _ := strconv.Atoi(matches[3])

        diagnostic := &rdf.Diagnostic{
            Message: matches[5],
            Location: &rdf.Location{
                Path: matches[1],
                Range: &rdf.Range{
                    Start: &rdf.Position{
                        Line:   int32(lineNum),
                        Column: int32(colNum),
                    },
                },
            },
            Severity: parseSeverity(matches[4]),
        }

        diagnostics = append(diagnostics, diagnostic)
    }

    return diagnostics, scanner.Err()
}

func parseSeverity(s string) rdf.Severity {
    switch s {
    case "error":
        return rdf.Severity_ERROR
    case "warning":
        return rdf.Severity_WARNING
    default:
        return rdf.Severity_INFO
    }
}
```
